post_title: Still possible to get last minutes tickets to a nativity scene today?

comments.author: Little_Paramedic_451
comments.body: There are many where you just stay on a queue. Try with Fundacion Cajasol, in Chicarreroa Street, pretty centric and they have a website

comments.author: 9kSs
comments.body: Do you know when is the show today? I don’t see it in the website

comments.author: Little_Paramedic_451
comments.body: It's not a show, it's a display... you can get more info on their website... it runs all day non-stop, and it's quite popular. I remember visiting it as a child. Some towns in the outskirts

comments.author: Zealousideal_West_16
comments.body: It's just a scene. Like a set up of miniatures. Nothing moves, there's no music, it's not theatre. So you can go any time and look at it. Just that there will be queues.

comments.author: theairscout
comments.body: That'd be something, a show. Can you imagine the had shows on about Christmas?

comments.author: Little_Paramedic_451
comments.body: There are some towns that have recreations on a schedule (imagine how painful can it be to redo from start every time a car parks in town... come on, boys, take the angel back to the top of the church! Star ready! On your marks! Where the hell is baby Jesús?)
